data.title: UUUUUmmm ok
data.text: My wife and I shared a 2 meat plate. Beef and Pulled pork. Sides were cole slaw and beans. I thought the brisket was dry. While certainly smoked still dry. The portions on the sides were very substantial.  For the price and hype will more then likely stick to Poppa's or Goode.

data.title: The worst beef ribs ever.
data.text:
I have eaten at many great BBQ places in TX, especially central Texas, and a friend and I wanted to try Killen's BBQ for the 1st time.  I had beef rib plate, he had 3 meat plate. The beef ribs were some of the greasiest ever, no comparison to Salt Lick in Driftwood. I tasted my friends brisket and we both agreed it was dry.  The 3 BBQ sauces on the table were not my favorite either.  We certainly will not wait 30 minutes again or probably stop there again.

Very expensive and over rated for sub par BBQ.

data.title: WOW WOW WOW
data.text: Wow what a great place to eat BBQ. You may have to wait a while in line out side but the free beer and drinks make up for it while waiting. The mac and cheese and cream corn is just brilliant, Beef ribs ( Perfect) Moist Brisket ( PERFECT) Chicken ( PERFECT) Pull Pork ( PERFECT)

data.title: So I C U R SERIOUS about BBQ!
data.text: Wow!. First bite was great until my plate was cleaned! We had beed ribs and brisket. Cream corn! Greensb best ever! Mac to the max! Ranch beans were great too! BBQ restaurants from my part of the world have some explaining to do!

data.title: OMG
data.text: We went here in a Wednesday around 1:30pm. There was no wait, but it would have been worth it had there been one. Most of us had brisket (OMG) and it was tender with just the right amount of fat. One friend got the sausage sandwich (heavenly) and another had the pork ribs (succulent). We tried the Mac & cheese (creamy deliciousness), French fries (drool-worthy), collards (oh snap!) and cole slaw (fresh and crunchy). To make sure we had a well-rounded meal, we also had the pecan pie and banana pudding (both delightful). It lives up to the hype. You won't regret a detour here!

data.title: Fabulous BBQ, great sides, and the most favorable iced tea!
data.text: Been to many BBQ restaurants in Texas, Black's, City Market, Eva Marie's, Hard Eights, Cooper's among others, Killen's far superior. We tried to two meat tray with brisket and sausage. Yummy! The sides are excellent; love the green beans (fresh!), Mac N Cheese outstanding, and Cole Slaw very tasty. What I really loved was the ice tea. The tea was refreshing and tasty. Had to wait about 40 minutes for Killen's to open. Worth every minute. If you are in the Houston area, drive south to Pearland and dine at Killen's. You will be glad you did. We will return.

data.title: pros and cons
data.text:
I moved from NC and finally tried Killens. We arrived a little before 10am (they open at 10). We waited about 45 minutes in line. 

We tried the 6 meat plate, burnt ends and the beef rib. We also tried several side items and the bread pudding. $75 for two. 

Pros:
- The beef rib is exceptional 
- Bread pudding is awesome
- Creamed corn is delicious (best side item). Mac n cheese is also good. 
- takeout available
- indoor and outdoor seating
- cafeteria style (helps wait times)
- street parking available across the street 

Cons:
- Several items on the 6 meat plate were cold
- Pricey
- no chicken (but the smoked turkey is a good substitute) 
- long line (45 min wait) outside (weather)

data.title: Best BBQ ever
data.text:
I'm not a big fan of BBQ. I don't like the smoke taste that goes throughout the food. But when in Texas you eat BBQ. 

I've never had such a great BBQ meal as I did today!! We got there just after 11.30am and joined the long queue in the sun waiting for the 12pm opening. We finally got to order about an hour later. 

They are pretty good at serving cafeteria style and getting you in and out in an orderly fashion. 

We ordered the beef rib plate and 2 meat plate with brisket and pork belly. Each of these plates comes with 2 sides. Creamed corn, coleslaw, baked beans and potato salad is what we got. 

Good golly miss molly!  I will be dreaming about that beef rib til I die. It was so good!  As were the other meats but you gotta have a favorite right!

If you are in the area, come eat here!  You will not be sorry.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: I'm definitely no authority on BBQ but the beef ribs and brisket I had here were the best BBQ I've had. The hot summers and long lines make it a difficult place for me to frequent. Still I have yet to be dissappointed and look forward to the next chance I get to go here.

data.title: Worth the wait
data.text: This place is busy. We had to wait in line for an hour. There is free water and beer for the people during the wait. The  meat is good. I can't compare to other bbq restaurants so i can't say if this is the best place in the Houston area but we definately enjoyed it. The beef ribs are big and juicy. Brisket is also good but a bit to fatty for my taste.  The Pulled pork is the dish I would recommend the most.

data.title: Over rated. Too expensive.
data.text: Over rated and to much misery and money for average food. Just your old average meats. But under rated sides. And desserts not to brag about. Try Big Horn bar b q on 288. Much nicer place.

data.title: Lunchtime at Killen's Barbecue
data.text:
The restaurant is clean, modern and well organized. Staff are polite and friendly. I gave it three stars because I do not believe this is the best barbecue around and certainly not worth waiting in line for. 
The brisket is dry and potato salad bland. I have eaten here three times but definitely prefer Rudy's.

data.title: Best BBQ ever
data.text: Wondered when we saw the line outside if the food would be worth the lengthy wait.  We were not disappointed.  It is truly the BEST BBQ ever.  We sampled a little bit of everything.  Can't nail down a specific recommendation because every bite was superb.  Do yourself a favor and go out of your way for a culinary treat.

data.title: FABULOUS MEAT - GREAT FOR TAKEOUT!
data.text: The Beef Ribs and brisket were very tender and served with a trio of delicious sauces.  They are delicious. The restaurant was clean and since we went mid afternoon, the entry line was less than 10 minutes.  So the score resulted from the disappointing sides with adequate potato salad and tasteless macaroni.  Avoid all desserts.

data.title: MOooo!!!!
data.text:
Made my pilgrimage to Killen's with the family on Sunday.  The weather finally cooled down a bit and nice enough to stand in line waiting for their famous grub.

I've been to Killen's a 3 or 4 times previously but the family hasn't.  We live about an hour away without traffic, and the weather was nice.   My teenager wanted to know why we are driving an hour and waiting in line to get the restaurant when there are so many BBQ places near us.  

As with most teenagers they are impatient and quantity is preferable to quality.   We finally got inside the building about an hour and forty five minutes after we left the house.   He was worried about what he wanted to order and my wife was a bit undecided as well.  But I volunteered to order for everyone.  Teenager said he was very hungry not having breakfast and all.   I said don't worry about it.  Finally got up to the counter and ordered.  the 6 meat plate with 2 sides.  When my teenager saw it his eyes bugged out!   We also ordered the beef rib ( it was about a foot long), a total of 3 sides and a slice of pecan pie.  

Everyone including myself was amazed at the quantity of food we got, 3 slices of brisket, pulled port, pork belly, sausage, 3 pork ribs, and smoked turkey on the 6 meat plate, plus a beef rib weighing almost a 1 1/2 lbs and 1 extra side and a slice of pie.  Can you say, " doggie bag"?

Teenager takes a small piece of beef rib and a smile broke across his face.   He was amazed, astonished and in bliss.  He devoured a sizeable portion of food, He was extremely happy and realized it was worth the drive and wait.  We ate all we could and took the rest home, over 1/2 of it.  There is enough for couple of more meals.  

Amazing.   It was worth the pilgrimage. We are already talking about our next visit.

data.title: Beef rib ecstasy!!!
data.text: I don't know how this place has any reviews less than 5!? I rank this BBQ shop one of the best ever. The beef ribs are easily the best I've ever had and I've had a lot of beef ribs! The wait wasn't as bad as I expected. This is a bit pricey but great BBQ usually is. A must try!!

data.title: The Best BBQ Around
data.text: The BBQ here is wonderful.  I have yet to have anything I didn't like, from fried fish to the sausage, ribs, brisket, you name it.  Killen's frequently has specials.  The tacos are unreal, the corn tortillas are obviously home made, you can still see bits of the ground masa.  The line varies from day to day, but Fridays seem to be the worst.  Consider coming in at 1pm to avoid them.  Don't let the reviews get your hopes up too high, the food is great, but it is food.  The prices are actually pretty reasonable.  A bit of history, the building is located in an old school cafeteria, you can still see the architectural remnants, which IMO adds to the atmosphere.  Staff are friendly and are constantly clearing tables.  The coffee BBQ sauce is my personal favorite.

data.title: Not that great
data.text: Killens steakhouse restaurant is one of the best steaks I've ever eaten....hands down,  and I have eaten and some of the best steakhouses in the world. So I assumed their barbecue place would be just as fantastic. I did not think it was. Far too expensive, the sauce was far too sweet, way too crowded. The food wasn't horrible but it was definitely ho hum and way way way too expensive I will not be going back

data.title: Good but not Great
data.text: I went to Killen's with friends and family when the friends came into town looking for what can best that can be described as the most famous BBQ place in the Pearland area. I was impressed with the beer awaiting those that were...waiting in line. The small serving area only accomodates 2-3 people which, in turn, heightens the wait. This does not equal a good product. No lie, the BBQ was great, I would never want to diminish the quality of the product, but it seemed that they wanted the wait to create anticipation. That formula doesn't equate a good BBQ which was average at best. If you really want a great BBQ, go to Joe's just down I-35 in Alvin. There is no pretensious wait and they have GREAT product.

data.title: Best BBQ Period!
data.text: 2 min from my house, best BBQ in Houston for sure! A little pricey to some, but the best should cost a little more, his creamed corn is best ever, Ronnie Killen knows food thats for sure, when he decided to become a chef, that was a perfect career choice.
